column4: I have an UPS Thermal Printer... I was wondering how I'd find a driver for it?
or unload it fully so vbox can pass through the usb
Zebra LP2844 (Labels itself UPS Thermal 2844 to the computer)
it's not exactly a common printer except amoung places like pharmacies and shipping docks
i'll google around for a minute
they cost over $600... and print on a very small label... their industrial =)
is it serial or parallel or usb?

I suspect there is a module attached to it even though it's not fully installed preventing VirtualBox from being able to make use of it. so a way to look determine which modules were using a usb device would also work
your vbox host is linux and the vbox guest is linux?
guest is windows... working on a work project that requires me to program an app that prints to it...
if it's supported in linux... I can just share it to the windows box... if it's pass-thru-able... that works even better
good point, i forgot about a net share
sadly, I havn't managed to convince the warehouse to switch to linux yet lol
i'm not useful with printers, i don't have one, but i know the older-style serial/parallel ones are super easy to interface with even without drivers
yeah... all of mine are network printers... this whole usb thing is foreign to me lol
